title: What do your mains say about you?
body: I saw a post about this a year ago. You can only pick 3. Mine are: {{champion:28}} , {{champion:40}} , and probably {{champion:54}}

replies.body:
{{champion:157}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:92}} 

Damage, Damage, and more Damage!

No, cancer would look lik this. 
{{champion:105}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:17}}  or {{champion:35}}
*Former Garen main*

If these are your mains, I would expect you are okay with getting out of your comfort zone since you can do multiple roles (good, I hope.)

{{champion:157}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:5}} (AP)

what the hell
You like being up close in fights most of the time. But if you can't do that, you could stay back and stun and/or heal. :)

> [{quoted}](name=AntiSkillshot,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=s6YYp89x,comment-id=007e,timestamp=2015-10-29T05:00:13.865+0000)
>
> Mesa, Valkyr, and Saryn...

You like dealing damage.  All the damage.  Your 4 key is beginning to show signs of wear.

> Oh, in League... Uhhh...
> 
> {{champion:81}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:10}}

You enjoy being a multi-level threat, ensuring the enemy needs a balanced (and expensive) defense to stop you completely.

{{champion:16}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:25}}

...I really like playing supports...

I would like to try Kayle Support, I've done it, it's just, I don't know what to build on her. Tips?

_"Look behind you!"_

Ardent Censor and Zeke's isn't half bad

But to be honest Kennen support does what Kayle support does but better
so like AP? Or tank?

Spellthief's, Censer, Zeke's, Rylai's, Boots, Sightstone. Wait for Zeke's proc -> Push W on carry -> laugh as carry gains 50% crit, 15% AS, 30 magic damage on-hit, and 45% movespeed. Throw in an ult if you want to let them dive with it.

Early game you punish, since your E+spellthief's proc *really* hurts at levels 1-3.
Mid-game you're playing defensive, patching up your carry and farming lane.
Once you have Censer and maybe Zeke's done, you can start enabling some dives.


In teamfights, you want to be ulting your carry or assassin when they go in, hitting W on whoever needs to engage or escape, and using Rylai's and Spellthief's on use to keep people from closing on your back line or preventing them from escaping when you engage.
